header: The European Perl Conference has finished, and it looks to have been a good 'un. You can watch videos of some of the talks, and more will eventually become available.
Wednesday is CPAN Day, so why not do something to give back to our crown jewel?

entries.text: CPAN Day is August 16th. If you can't think of something to do on that day, why not help us fix up distributions that don't have either of META.yml or META.json.

entries.text: A long review of Rakudo that tries to give a balanced perspective, after using it for a while, and writing a small library in it. One of his summary lines is that Rakudo "lacks a strong 'hook', and it's also kind of slow", and also "certainly alone in the audacity of its ambitions and sheer complexity of the language".

entries.author: will_coleda
entries.title: Grant Proposal: Complete YAML::PP
entries.text: Tina Müller has requested a grant of $2500 to complete YAML::PP, a new pure perl YAML parser, a key goal for which is support of YAML 1.2. If you've got an opinion, you can share it in the comments.

entries.title: Grant approved: revitalize blogs.perl.org

entries.text: The grant proposal by André Walker, to sort out blogs.perl.org, has been approved.

entries.author: dan_wright
entries.title: Hotel rooms and The Perl Conference
entries.text: This year TPF ended up having to pay $10k for hotel rooms that weren't taken up for YAPC::NA. Dan explains why, and what is going to change as a result.
